radiographic_examinations.findings: T2-weighted hyperintense lesion in the left motor strip involving the adjacent white matter; focal cortical dysplasia; no clear evidence of atrophy.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive atrophy in the left cerebral hemisphere; enlargement of the left inferior, middle, and superior frontal sulci and left parieto-occipital sulci with underlying cortex thinning.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Seizure activity in the left frontal lobe, predominantly in the posterior left frontal cortex and area associated with motor control.
Focus of continuous right facial twitching in the left frontal area; generalized tonicâ€“clonic seizures recorded.
Lesion with high signal intensity in the precentral and postcentral gyri, involving the cortex and subcortical white matter.

radiographic_examinations.date: Between 6 years and 8 years of age
radiographic_examinations.findings: Progressive atrophy in the left cerebral hemisphere with features suggestive of focal cortical dysplasia.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive cortical atrophy and loss of white-matter volume.
